reviews.text: My sister and I stayed at this hotel during the CMA fest. So even though its a good 30 minutes out from Nashville, it was quite busy. There was not a vacant room in the place. Infact, they were having to send people hours away for a room somewhere else. That being said, the service was great for a fully booked hotel. When we arrived our room wasn't ready yet and the friendly girl at the front desk offered us information on where we could go eat in the area. The breakfast staff was also wonderful. And when we would come in late at night from all the festivies, everyone greeted us with a smile. The rooms are nicely decorated in all modern finishes. My only complaint was that the room did not seem as clean as other hampton inns I have stayed in. This could be because they were booked solid, but still this is something you expect. My pillows were dirty with what looked to be make up when we arrived in our room. Also, the bathroom needed to be cleaned. Overall, we had a nice stay though.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Friendly Staff

reviews.text: Was here for 2 nights on business. This is a very clean and well maintained hotel. Next door to an Outback Restaurant and across from the Home Depot. Seems fairly new. Rooms were spacious, quiet and reasonably priced. Breakfast buffett was standard fare. Would stay again.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: My wife traveled with some friends and checked in ahead of me by several hours. When I arrived I was exhausted and as I checked in the attendant was friendly and was expecting me. I was given a key card and told where my room was located. The following morning we were met by the NICEST lady that I believe has ever been in the hotel industry, Gwen, she was the cook/kitchen staff/clean up crew all in one. Saturday we were in a hurry to get to our event and even though we had eaten she sent us with "to go" breakfast since we were eating so early. She also took special care with my 19 month old son and told us that Sunday she would have eggs, biscuits, and gravy for him. The next morning when we went down we were again greeted by her smile and hospitality. I had an issue with the free wireless internet and tried to fix the problem myself, after an hour I went downstairs at around midnight and told the desk clerk that there was a problem with the internet. She was quick to connect me to an on-call person and they walked me through the set up and within ten minutes I was surfing again. Although this is a new hotel they have service down pat and know how to treat their guests.
reviews.title: The hotel was quiet and the service was excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a brand new, beautifully decorated and appointed hotel. As noted before, be sure and ask for a room "away from traffic noise" or you will be almost on I-40. The Hampton Directory indicated this hotel had an "indoor" pool. When we originally made this reservation, even their website indicated an indoor pool (although this has been corrected since). There is no indoor pool. We chose this hotel based on the pool - it has only an outdoor pool and it was closed for the season when we stayed here. While this is a small complaint, compared to the other fine qualities of this hotel, if this is important to you, then you should be aware. The restaurant options are an Outback Restaurant just across the parking lot. Overall, our stay here was very enjoyable. The staff is helpful and upbeat - - I am not sure how Hampton does this, but their personnel is always most pleasant! One thing I have noticed is that the standard rooms at Hamptons have poor lighting in the bathrooms. The upgraded rooms and suites have better lighting.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, but no indoor pool

reviews.text: We loved the new Hampton Inn. We asked to stay on the quiet side, as the property backs up to the interstate. The rooms were well thought out, as was the breakfast room. Relaxing color palette was a bonus. The parking lot is a little rough, so do be careful.
reviews.title: Lovely new hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at this Hampton Inn during a road trip to the NE. It is well located along I-40, well maintained, clean, quiet and comfortable. The rooms are very nice, especially for this price class of property, with all the amenties you might expect. The staff were all friendly, efficient and professional. The complimentary breakfast, which includes eggs and sausage and fresh cooked waffles, is well above average. I would certainly stay here again if I were in the area.
reviews.title: Better than good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this property to extremely accommodating, with a large handicap accessible room, room placement convenience and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Great Property especially for Handicapped

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: When entering the room from the nearby elevator, the floor is not carpeted, which makes it so easy to bring the wheelchair in from the hallway. (The rest of the room is carpeted.) Not having to push a wheelchair down a long hallway was a big relief. Even the ice machine and the beverage machine was nearby.
reviews.title: VERY NICE AND COZY ROOMS, PLEASENTLY SUPRISED!!

reviews.text: Staff: We arrived early and our room was not quite ready. It was very hot outside when we got there. We were given complimentary bottles of ice cold water and warm chocolate cookies and a confortable place to sit while we waited about 5 minutes.
reviews.title: Pleasant place to stay along I-40

reviews.text: Our room was clean, beds comfortable, atmosphere quiet and peaceful. Breakfast was very good...hot, cold, plentiful.
reviews.title: A nice place to stop after a long day of driving.
